channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This Gen Zer dropped out of college and is making over $100,000 repairing plane engines after 21 months of training

item.title: Are leaders born or made?

item.title: Trump’s hand in the tariff war he started gets weaker as China GDP comes in ahead of growth forecasts
item.description: President Trump’s tariff leverage over China faces new strain as Beijing’s economy posts stronger-than-expected growth and diversifies exports.

item.title: America’s healthcare system is working out how to function with fewer immigrants and an aging population—it’s not going particularly well

item.title: 47 Startups Failed. Most Made the Same Coding Mistake
item.description: Moving fast while code breaks might work for companies with deep pockets. But does it work for startups? Debatable.

item.title: AMD’s Lisa Su and HP’s Enrique Lores describe how they went from ho-hum to high-end

item.title: The Stock Market Is Turning Volatile Again and It’s Bullish for Investors
item.description: Regional bank fears have injected fresh concerns into the bull market.

item.title: Layoffs can shake company culture. Here’s how leaders can repair it.

item.title: Why You Should Think Like a Startup With Nothing to Lose
item.description: Most established companies struggle to innovate, not because they lack smart people, but because their own success traps them.

item.title: Dow futures rally as Trump softens tone on trade war again while first tech earnings and inflation report loom
item.description: On Tuesday, Netflix and Texas Instruments are due. On Wednesday, Tesla and IBM will report, while Intel is scheduled for Thursday.
